title: How to Store and Share Your Videos on Smugmug

steps.headline: Click “Login” at the top of the page.
Enter the email and password associated with your SmugMug account.
steps.description: Click here to learn how to create an account on SmugMug. Alternatively, you can login into SmugMug with your Facebook account by clicking the Facebook Login icon.

steps.headline: Click “My Homepage” at the top of the page.
Click the “Upload” tab and select an Existing Gallery to upload your videos to.
steps.description: Click “New Gallery” if you want to create a new gallery to store your videos.

steps.headline: Drag and drop videos from your computer to the “Drop ‘em here” icon.
steps.description: Alternatively, you can click the "Browse” button to use a traditional file browser to select videos stored on your computer.

steps.headline: Click the video you wish to share from your gallery.
Select whether to share your video via email, via a SmugMug URL, or a social network or bookmarking website.
steps.description: Clicking “Be social” will allow you to share your videos via Twitter, Facebook, or Tumblr. Hovering over “Social Bookmarking” will provide you with a list of supported social bookmarking services you can share your videos with.

text: Visit the SmugMug website.  Click “Login” at the top of the page.  Enter the email and password associated with your SmugMug account. Click here to learn how to create an account on SmugMug. Alternatively, you can login into SmugMug with your Facebook account by clicking the Facebook Login icon. Click “My Homepage” at the top of the page.  Click the “Upload” tab and select an Existing Gallery to upload your videos to. Click “New Gallery” if you want to create a new gallery to store your videos. Drag and drop videos from your computer to the “Drop ‘em here” icon. Alternatively, you can click the "Browse” button to use a traditional file browser to select videos stored on your computer. Click “I’m Done Uploading”.  Click the video you wish to share from your gallery.  Click the “Share” tab.  Select whether to share your video via email, via a SmugMug URL, or a social network or bookmarking website. Clicking “Be social” will allow you to share your videos via Twitter, Facebook, or Tumblr. Hovering over “Social Bookmarking” will provide you with a list of supported social bookmarking services you can share your videos with.
